English (United States)(en-US): Mold.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 곰팡이.

English (United States)(en-US): Confronting the wind ripping through the\nopen window, I’m now covered in dust.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 창문 너머로 불어오는 바람을 온몸으로\n맞이하다 먼지 투성이가 되어 버렸어.

English (United States)(en-US): Hm. Hm. It’s a novel experience. I’ve seen the\ncity’s nooks and crannies, but this was a first.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음, 음, 아주 신선한 경험이야. 도시\n곳곳을 다녔지만 이런 적은 처음이었어.

English (United States)(en-US): Such fierce winds!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 바람이 얼마나 맹렬하던지!

English (United States)(en-US): So. What I mean is.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모쪼록, 그러니까.

English (United States)(en-US): I feel! I feel happy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는! 나는 기분이 좋아.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ve told you before. It feels like I’ve\nbecome the sweetest, fluffiest cotton candy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>에게도 선언했지. 아주 달콤하고\n부드러운 솜사탕이 된 것만 같다고.

English (United States)(en-US): How would I feel in someone’s\nmouth? Crunchy, or squishy?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 식감도 얼마나 다채롭겠어?\n오독오독, 말캉말캉.

English (United States)(en-US): What? “Don’t lie?”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 거짓말하지 말라고?

English (United States)(en-US): Oh.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아.

English (United States)(en-US): Haha, you must be mistaken.\nI’m smiling, you see?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하하하, 그렇게 보여?\n아니야. 나는 웃고 있잖아?

English (United States)(en-US): …… You’re right.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): …… 그래, 네 말이 맞는 것 같지.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s all a lie. I’m not happy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 전부 거짓말이야. 나 행복하지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): I won’t be sweet or soft. At all.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 실은 하나도 달콤하고\n부드럽지 않을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): It’ll be prickly and itchy. All the hours I’ll endure\nwill taste like very very unpleasant waste.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 따갑고 가려울 거야. 내가 견뎌야 할 모든\n시간에서 아주 아주 불쾌한 오물 맛이 날 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): … What if it has already\nhorribly clung to me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): … 이미 끔찍하게 유착되어\n버린 거면 어쩌지.

English (United States)(en-US): What if it will remain as a nerve-gnawing,\nbedbug-like feeling and plague me forever and ever?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 신경을 잘근잘근 물어뜯는 빈대 같은 감각으로\n남아, 영원히 영원히 날 괴롭힐 거라면.

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t want that.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 싫어.

English (United States)(en-US): Ah, I haven’t embraced this\nfeeling. I want to escape it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아. 나는 이 감각을 받아들이지\n못했구나. 나는 벗어나고 싶구나.

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t, no, I can’t leave this feeling alone.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 이것을 도무지 그대로\n내버려 두기가 싫은 거구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Then…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇다면…

English (United States)(en-US): What if I look at it? Just look at it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 바라본다면. 바라볼 수만 있다면?

English (United States)(en-US): But.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만.

English (United States)(en-US): Won’t it hurt? Won’t the pain of\nremoving it finally burst me open?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아프지는 않을까? 뽑아 낼 때의 고통이\n날 기어이 터트려 버리지는 않을까?

English (United States)(en-US): Still. I can do it. I know I can do it. My\nsticky body will be stronger than I think, So……
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래도. 할 수 있어. 할 수 있을 거야. 내\n끈적한 몸은 생각보다 강할 거야. 그러니…….

English (United States)(en-US): Huh?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어?

English (United States)(en-US): It hurts. But.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아파. 아프지만.

English (United States)(en-US): It hurts, but my body didn’t burst.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아프지만, 몸이 터지지는 않았어.

English (United States)(en-US): It was okay.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 괜찮았어.

English (United States)(en-US): … Hello, mold.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): … 안녕, 곰팡이.

English (United States)(en-US): I read that humans inevitably feel pain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간은 필연적으로 아픔을\n겪는다는 글을 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): And that after embracing all\nthat hurt, when it ebbs away,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 아픔을 끌어안아 고통이\n무뎌지는 모든 시간의 끝에,

English (United States)(en-US): that’s when humans believe they grow.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들은 ‘성장’이 놓여 있다 믿는대.

English (United States)(en-US): Pain…… and growth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아픔, 그리고 성장.

English (United States)(en-US): Would you like to know something, friend?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 있잖아, 친구야, 그것 알아?

English (United States)(en-US): There’s pain on the dark\nside of the moon, too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달 뒤편에도 아픔이 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Beings that embrace pain twice,\nthrice their size with all their might,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 몸집보다 몇 배는 큰 아픔을\n사지로 아등바등 끌어안고,

English (United States)(en-US): and look down at the ground\nhoping it will ebb away.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무뎌지길 바라며 묵묵히 땅을 보는.

English (United States)(en-US): I know them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런 이들이 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): They readily bear the pain. It contorts\nand disfigures them, body and soul.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들은 아픔을 사지로 품어. 그 통증은 그들\n몸과 영혼의 모양을 뒤틀어 변하게 만들지.

English (United States)(en-US): But what’s at the end of the road\ndoesn’t seem like growth to me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다만, 난 그 끝에 놓인 게\n성장 같아 보이지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s too simple of a word.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런 단편적인 단어로 정의될 수 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): Hmm….
Red hated the cold.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드는 추위를 미워했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Because the human he loved threw\n himself into freezing water and died.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑했던 인간이 차디찬 물에\n몸을 던져 죽었기 때문이지.

English (United States)(en-US): His final day that Red saw was very\nlonely, very dark, and very, very cold.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마지막으로 보았던 그 인간의 하루는 아주\n외롭고, 아주 어두웠으며, 아주 아주 추웠대.

English (United States)(en-US): Red could no longer\nmake dreams for his human.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드는 더 이상 그를 위한\n꿈을 만들 수 없었어.

English (United States)(en-US): For the agonizing cold was\nfollowed by the pitch-black dark,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 강한 추위 뒤엔 아주\n시커먼 암흑이 뒤따랐고,

English (United States)(en-US): dreams had no place among it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그곳에 꿈을 위한 자리는 없었으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): From that day on, he\nbegan to burn himself slowly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드는 그날부터 아주 느리게\n자기 몸을 불태우기로 해.

English (United States)(en-US): Hating the cold that took his human\naway, and hoping, even if it’s too late,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그를 끌고 갔던 추위를 미워하고, 또 미워하며…\n어떻게든, 이미 늦었더라도, 조금이나마.

English (United States)(en-US): to warm his human.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그를 따스하게 데워 줄 수 있기를 바라며.

English (United States)(en-US): There also was someone who hated\nignorance. She named herself Edison.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무지를 미워하던 자도 있었어. 그녀는\n자신의 이름을 ‘에디슨’이라 지었지.

English (United States)(en-US): She wore square-rimmed spectacles and\nhad a never-ending curiosity for humans,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 둥근 전구 머리에 비해 유독 각진 돌 안경을 쓰던\n그녀는 인간에 대한 끈끈한 탐구욕이 있었지만

English (United States)(en-US): but her drive was fuelled by resentment.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 집념의 동력은 원망이었어.

English (United States)(en-US): Because not until her beloved\nhuman hung himself…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑하는 인간이 스스로\n목을 매달 때까지도…

English (United States)(en-US): did Edison realize that something was\nwrong. So she resents her ignorance.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무언가 잘못되어 가고 있다는 것을 전혀 알아차리지\n못했던, 자신의 무지를 향한 원망 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s just. Just. Just.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그냥. 그냥. 그냥.

English (United States)(en-US): The moon was strewn\nwith all kinds of hurt.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런 아픔들이 군데군데\n널려 있었어, 달에는.

English (United States)(en-US): To be able to walk steadily\nthrough such ruins…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 폐허를 잘 걸을 줄 알게 되는 것…

English (United States)(en-US): To bear them in silence, without a sound.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 폐허를 묵묵히, 소리 없이 견디게 되는 것.

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps, in a way that’s\nfrustrating and deformed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어쩌면 조금은 답답하고\n기형적일지 모르는 방식으로.

English (United States)(en-US): I wonder, if even this can be called growth…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이런 것마저도 성장이라\n부르게 되는 걸까….

English (United States)(en-US): I wonder—will they welcome such a word?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 과연, 그들은 그 단어를 환영할까?

English (United States)(en-US): Today while on the street I saw\na small child, and our eyes met.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘 길을 가다 한 아이와 눈이 마주쳤어.

English (United States)(en-US): That is to say,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니까,

English (United States)(en-US): Our eyes met.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): "눈이 마주쳤어.”

English (United States)(en-US): Oh?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응?

English (United States)(en-US): (Wait… can other people see Dot?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (잠시만… 다른 사람들이 뭉치를 볼 수 있었던가?)

English (United States)(en-US): (That can’t be.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (그럴 리가 없을 텐데.)

English (United States)(en-US): Your eyes met?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 눈이 마주쳤다고?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. You see, I’m merely a\npassive observer on the street.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응. 있지, 보통의 거리들에서 나는\n언제나, 오로지 관찰자로 존재하지.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ve never interacted with\na human apart from you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 아닌 다른 인간과의 교류는 없었어.\n손인사도, 눈인사도, 심지어 눈맞춤도.

English (United States)(en-US): For some reason… they\ncan't seem to see me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들은 어떤 이유에서인지…\n나를 볼 수 없는 것 같았거든.

English (United States)(en-US): If people saw you on the street,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아마 사람들이 걸어다니는 뭉치를 봤다면

English (United States)(en-US): you would make the front page.|they would lose their heads.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뉴스에 대서특필되었을 거야.|놀라서 자빠졌을걸.

English (United States)(en-US): Anyway. What happened?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하여튼. 그래서 무슨 일이 있었던 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): I was walking down the street\nobserving people as usual.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 평소처럼 사람들을 바라보며\n길을 걷고 있었는데 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): When I made eye contact with a child!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 아이와 눈이 마주쳤어!

English (United States)(en-US): He stared at me with a stunned expression…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 애는 약 오 초 가량 나를 바라보다가,\n다소 벙찐 표정을 짓다가…

English (United States)(en-US): and blinked a couple of times,\nbefore dropping his ice cream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 눈을 끔뻑거리더니 손에 쥔\n아이스크림을 바닥에 떨어뜨렸지.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh no, what a waste.|Poor boy. He must have been crushed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 저런, 아이스크림 아까워서 어떡해.|저런, 먹지도 못해서 속상했겠다.

English (United States)(en-US): I said, “Hello, boy. Today we meet.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 “안녕, 꼬마야. 처음 보네.”라고 했어.

English (United States)(en-US): “Who are you?” the boy whispered,\ncrouching down to get a closer look at me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “넌 누구야?”, 그 애가 속삭이며 날\n더 가까이 보기 위해 쪼그려 앉았지.

English (United States)(en-US): “I’m Dot. I come from the moon—”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 이렇게 대답해 주었어.\n“난 뭉치야. 달에서 왔어.”

English (United States)(en-US): “The dark side of it,” I replied. He’s the first\nperson to know my name apart from you!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “달의 어두운 뒤편 말이야.” 너 아닌 누군가가\n처음으로 나의 이름을 알게 된 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): A historical moment! And\nwhat did he say to that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 제법 역사적인 순간인걸!\n그 애가 뭐라고 대답했어?

English (United States)(en-US): He told me that he never knew\nthere was a dark side of the moon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달에 ‘뒤편’이 있을 줄 몰랐대. 아이는 항상\n지구의 하늘에서, 달의 밝은 면만 보았으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): So I said “There is, in fact. There’s\nalso a beautiful factory over there.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 난 정정해 주었어. “달의 뒤편이 존재하고\n말고. 그곳엔 아름다운 공장도 있어!”

English (United States)(en-US): “Somehow humans and their space\ncameras never seem to notice, though.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “무슨 이유에서인지 인간과 그들의 우주 카메라는\n전혀 눈치채지 못하는 것 같지만.”

English (United States)(en-US): And what did he say?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그랬더니 뭐라고 해?

English (United States)(en-US): He didn’t believe you, did he?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안 믿지 않아?

English (United States)(en-US): No, he did believe me. He\neven asked questions about it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니, 그 애는 내 말을 믿어 주었는걸?\n나에게 이런저런 질문도 했어!

English (United States)(en-US): “What do they make?\nIn that factory?”, he said.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “무엇을 만드는 공장인데?”

English (United States)(en-US): So I told him, “They make dreams.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “꿈을 만드는 공장이야.”

English (United States)(en-US): “What kind of dream?”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “어떤 꿈?”

English (United States)(en-US): “The bedtime kind of dream. The night,\nthe star, the moon kind of dream.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “자장가들의 꿈. 밤, 별, 그리고 달의 꿈.”\n이 말을 들은 그 애는 아주 들떠 보였어!

English (United States)(en-US): “Oh. That’s nice.” His smile\nwas as pure as a snowflake.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “우와, 신기하다!” 눈송이처럼 순수한\n눈을 하고, 함박웃음을 지었어.

English (United States)(en-US): After remaining silent for a\nwhile, he carefully asked,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잠시 침묵하다 그 애는 아주\n조심스러운 눈치로 이런 질문을 했어.

English (United States)(en-US): “Could you tell them to make\nsweeter dreams for my little sister?”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “그런데… 내 어린 여동생을 위해 조금만 더\n다정한 꿈을 만들어 달라고 부탁할 수 있을까?”

English (United States)(en-US): “She’s been having nightmares lately.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “요즘 자주 악몽을 꿔.”

English (United States)(en-US): “Monsters, ghosts, and beasts with a\ngreat number of teeth hunt her down.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “사악한 괴물, 귀신, 그리고 이빨이\n아주 많은 짐승들이 걔를 사냥한대.”

English (United States)(en-US): She tries to find a closet to hide… but\nthey catch her first,” the boy frowned.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “동생은 몸을 숨길 장롱을 찾으려 하지만…\n그들이 먼저 자기를 잡아 버린대.” 아이는 시무룩해졌어.

English (United States)(en-US): What an awful dream. She must be so scared.|All children that age are afraid of monsters.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 못된 꿈이네. 어린 아이가 많이 무섭겠다.|그 나이에는 다 괴물들을 무서워하지.

English (United States)(en-US): So I said, “I’m not sure if I can\nreach them from here, but I’ll try.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 뭉클해진 마음으로, “닿을지는 모르겠지만\n그 말을 전달해 주려 노력해 볼게.” 했지.

English (United States)(en-US): (Be moved by the story.)|(Think of a solution.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (따뜻한 이야기에 감동한다.)|(해결책을 고민해 본다.)

English (United States)(en-US): What a sweet, lovely child… I would\nreally like to make his wish come true.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 따뜻하고 사랑스러운 아이야….\n꼭 소원이 이루어지도록 돕고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, how about using the moon\ntransmitter! I’ll send a letter tonight.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 달 송신기를 사용해서 그 애의 소원을 전달할\n수 있겠어! 오늘 밤 달에 편지를 보내 볼게.

English (United States)(en-US): Your kindness always moves\nme. Thank you, <nickname>!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 따뜻함은 나를 언제나\n감동하게 해. 고마워, <nickname>!

English (United States)(en-US): I wonder if there’s a way\nfor his wish to come true…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 아이의 소원이 이루어질\n방법이 있으려나….

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, how about using the moon\ntransmitter? I’ll send a letter tonight.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 달 송신기를 사용해서 그 애의 소원을 전달할\n수 있겠어! 오늘 밤 달에 편지를 보내 볼게.

English (United States)(en-US): Your wiseness always inspires\nme. Thank you, <nickname>!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 현명함은 언제나 나에게\n큰 영감이 돼. 고마워, <nickname>!

English (United States)(en-US): I’m glad I could help!\nAnyways, back to the story?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하하, 내 손으로 두 아이를 행복하게 할 수\n있다면야! 아무튼, 다시 이야기해 줄래?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, yes! It was just then.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 응! 그런데 그때.

English (United States)(en-US): That someone tugged him from\nbehind. “Mom!” the boy yelled.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 남자아이를 잡아채는 손길이\n나타났어. “엄마!” 아이가 외쳤지.

English (United States)(en-US): “What were you doing crouched\non the floor! Your pants are all dirty.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “잠깐도 못 기다리고 쪼그려\n앉아서… 바지가 다 더러워졌잖니.”

English (United States)(en-US): “Mom, this is Dot. They come from\nthe moon, the darker side of it!”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “엄마, 엄마, 얘는 뭉치래요. 달에서\n왔대요! 달의 어두운 뒤편에서요.”

English (United States)(en-US): “They told me all about the moon\nfactory there!” the child exclaimed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “그곳에 있는 꿈 공장에 대해서도 이야기\n해 줬어요!” 아이가 신나서 이야기하는데,

English (United States)(en-US): “That’s nice, dear. But Andy, none of\nthose things are real,” said the mother.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “상상력이 풍부하구나. 그런데\n지우야, 그런 건 존재하지 않는단다.”

English (United States)(en-US): “They only exist in books. Let’s go home,”\n the mother persuaded him,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “책은 책으로만 읽어야지, 과도한 상상은\n좋지 않아. 집에 가자.” 엄마는 그를 타일렀지.

English (United States)(en-US): (Sympathize with his predicament.)|(Keep on listening.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (아이에게 공감하며 탄식한다.)|(가만히 이야기를 듣는다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Oh no… he must have been quite upset.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아이고…. 꼬마가 제법 속상했겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): I see…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그랬구나….

English (United States)(en-US): The boy turned around one last time,\nand as our eyes met I asked myself;
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뒤를 돌아보는 아이와 마지막으로\n눈을 맞추며 자문했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Does growing up mean no longer believing \nin the moon beings, in the dream factory… in me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어른이 된다는 건, 달 뒤편에서 온 생명체와\n꿈 공장의 존재를 믿지 못하게 된다는 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): Adults live in a tougher and drier world.\nSo lots of people lose the ability to believe.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어른의 세계는 아이의 것보다 억세고 건조해.\n그래서 믿을 능력을 잃어버린 사람들이 많아.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, oh… well.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 아… 음.

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps his innocence is like\nthe ice cream he dropped.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 아이의 순수함은 어쩌면 그 애가\n떨어뜨렸던 아이스크림처럼,

English (United States)(en-US): Fresh and crisp at first… but a sticky\npuddle by the time he’s an adult,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 처음엔 신선하게 사각거리다가도… 시간이\n지나 어른이 될 즈음이면 다 녹아 끈적해져서

English (United States)(en-US): making him mutter, “Blegh, what a mess,”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘으으, 걸리적거려.’

English (United States)(en-US): before wiping it away—\nor something like that.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하며 깨끗하게 닦아내 버리고\n싶게 되는—그런 게 아닐까.

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps it’s not that adults\n<i>can’t<\i> believe anymore.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 순수를 잃은 어른들은 ‘못’\n믿게 되는 게 아닐 수 있겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps they close their eyes or avert their\ngaze because they don’t want to see.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 더 이상 보고 싶지 않기 때문에 부러 눈을\n감아 버리거나, 돌려 버리는 것 아닐까?

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps they throw away the\nability to believe of their own will.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 믿을 능력을 잃어버린 게\n아니라 스스로 버린 것일지도.

English (United States)(en-US): …. And so some things are lost.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): …. 그렇게 어떤 것들은 사라지겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): Forever.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 영영.

English (United States)(en-US): No way! It’s as soft as a baby\nlamb that just took its first steps…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 말도 안 돼! 막 걸음마를 뗀\n아기 양의 솜털처럼 보드라워…

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, I know!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 나 알겠어!

English (United States)(en-US): I read about a legendary creature\nnamed Pegasus a while ago.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 얼마 전에 책에서 ‘페가수스’라고\n불리우는 전설적인 동물을 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): It had brilliant, radiant wings and\nthe beautiful body of a horse.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그는 찬란히 빛나는 날개에 아름다운\n말의 몸을 가지고 있었지.

English (United States)(en-US): Mesmerizing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 눈을 떼기 어려울 정도로 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Delicate but elegant. This thing\nmust be made out of its feathers!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 여리지만 우아해. 이것은 그의\n깃털을 엮어 만든 게 분명해!

English (United States)(en-US): You brought this precious\nglorious present just for me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오로지 나를 위해 이 귀하고\n황홀한 선물을 가지고 와 준 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): (Pegasi aren’t real. Refute.)|(Incorrect, but protect Dot’s happiness nonetheless.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (페가수스는 없다. 반박한다.)|(틀렸지만 뭉치의 행복을 지켜 준다.)

English (United States)(en-US): It is a gift, just for you!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너만을 위한 선물을 맞아!

English (United States)(en-US): But I don’t think pegasi are real.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 페가수스는 아마\n존재하지 않을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Then whose feathers are these?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼 이건 누구의 깃털이야?

English (United States)(en-US): Actually, they don’t belong to anyone.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 실은 누구의 깃털도 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): Talented people can make all\nthis out of thread. Neat, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들은 손재주가 좋아 얇은 실 하나로도\n이렇게 멋진 걸 만들어 낼 수 있거든!

English (United States)(en-US): Of course! I had a feeling you’d like it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼! 네가 이걸 좋아할\n것 같다는 생각이 들었어.

English (United States)(en-US): That’s so thoughtful of you,\nit feels like a second gift.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 밖에서도 나를 생각해주다니,\n두 번째 선물처럼 느껴져.

English (United States)(en-US): So… what’s it called?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼… 이 물건의 이름은 뭐야?

English (United States)(en-US): It’s called a ‘dreamcatcher’. People hang\nit over a bed before they go to sleep.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 ‘드림 캐쳐’라고 불러. 인간이\n잠을 잘 때 침대맡에 걸어 두는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): It catches our nightmares like a net would.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 우리들의 악몽을\n그물처럼 포획해 주거든.

English (United States)(en-US): So that we dream only of sweet\nthings, and get a good night’s sleep.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 악몽을 걸러 줘 좋은 꿈만 꾸게 하고,\n잠을 푹 잘 수 있도록 하는 친구야.

English (United States)(en-US): What is it, Dot?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 왜 그래?

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, helping someone\nfall asleep is no small feat!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 누군가를 편히 잠들게\n한다는 건 아무나 할 수 없는 일이야!

English (United States)(en-US): Some find it hard to submerge themselves\ninto the welcoming darkness of the night.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고민거리가 많은 이들은\n어둠에 따스히 잠기지 못해.

English (United States)(en-US): That’s when their doubts that hide\nin the shadows come out to play.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 낮 동안 숨어 있던 서늘한 감정들이\n방문을 두드리며 찾아오니까.

English (United States)(en-US): So basically, dreamcatchers\nare the ‘Keeper of the Night’!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니까 ‘드림 캐처’는,\n잠의 문지기 같은 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): They keep you safe from\nthe chills of the night!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 깊은 밤의 차가움으로부터\n인간의 수면을 지켜주고 있는!

English (United States)(en-US): …… Kind. Trustworthy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): …… 다정해. 듬직해.

English (United States)(en-US): This with a cup of warm milk, and\nno nightmare stands a chance.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 김이 모락모락 나는 부드러운 우유\n한 컵과 함께하면 못 이길 악몽이 없겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): It feels like a dream to be\nable to go to sleep with this!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이게 나와 함께 잠들게 되다니 꿈만 같아!

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, but.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 음.

English (United States)(en-US): What’s wrong, Dot?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜 그래, 뭉치?

English (United States)(en-US): But, but.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데, 그런데.

English (United States)(en-US): Where do captured nightmares go, then?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 있지, 그럼 포획된 악몽들은 어디로 가?

English (United States)(en-US): Well, I don’t know either.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 글쎄, 나도 모르겠네.

English (United States)(en-US): People only seem to care about\na good night’s sleep. Why?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다들 평화로운 잠을 자는\n걸로 만족할 뿐인 듯해. 왜?

English (United States)(en-US): I want to know where\nthey ultimately end up.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 악몽들의 최종 종착지가 궁금해서.

English (United States)(en-US): I know them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 그들을 알아.

English (United States)(en-US): We’re alike.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 닮아 있거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Not quite the same, but\nI know how they feel.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 똑같진 않아도, 마음을 알 수 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe they're crying on the\ninside while tormenting humans.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사람들을 괴롭히면서도,\n속으로는 울고 있지 않을까.

English (United States)(en-US): ‘If only I could be a happy dream too.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘나도 행복한 꿈이 되고 싶었는데.’

English (United States)(en-US): ‘If only I could make someone\nsmile in their sleep too.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘나도 누군가를 잠결에\n핏- 웃게 하고 싶었는데.’

English (United States)(en-US): Nightmares torment\nhumans, so I hate them,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간을 괴롭히는 악몽이 미우면서도

English (United States)(en-US): yet imagining one captured by a\ndreamcatcher makes me shudder.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 드림 캐쳐한테 포획되는 순간을\n상상하니 눈이 질끈 감겨.

English (United States)(en-US): How afraid they must be.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 얼마나 두려울까.

English (United States)(en-US): How terrifying an end it must be….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 끝이 얼마나 공포스러울까….
